item.description:
HELLO ASL ENTHUSIASTS!

OK, figured should get this out there so folks can start making plans, arrangements, whatnot.

"DeafNation Expo is the foremost touring trade show for, by, and about deaf people. DeafNation provides exhibitions and entertainment around the United States at no charge to the public."

I've never been to one of these - my curious mind wants to know what's new out there. DOES YOURS?

Yeah, it's gonna be a long day. Yeah, it's gonna be a long drive - but well worth it! (I have this on high authority from a "Groovy Grrl" down in CT! )

WHAT: DeafNation Expo, Saturday, Sept. 25, 2010. Expo starts 9:00am, ends 5:00pm. ADMISSION IS FREE!!!

EXPO LINK: http://deafnation.com...

WHERE: DCU Center
50 Foster Street
Worcester, MA 01608

WHEN: Sept. 25, 2010

TIME: 9am - 5pm (we'll figure out OUR time as we get closer)

COST: FREE!!! Register ONLINE at link ABOVE. Do it SOON, can only fit so many people.

WHY: "DeafNation Expo is the foremost touring trade show for, by, and about deaf people. DeafNation provides exhibitions and entertainment around the United States at no charge to the public."


-- COMMUNICATION & ENTERTAINMENT are the words for the DAY --

More will be posted later about transportation, and for those going, please let's all get in touch so we can figure out car-pooling, etc. So far, those who have "liked" the idea know my personal email, and if you contact me via MEETUP email, I will give you it when I reply.

There IS public transportation, of sorts: Worcester Amtrak goes to "The Centrum," as most of us locals know it, as does the Framingham / Worcester Bus Line ("T"). For our purposes, maybe having two (or more) cars go is a good idea. I know I may not be able to stay the entire time, and therefore MUST take my own vehicle - with room for people: It's a Chevy Blazer, 4-door, bucket seats in front, bench seat in back (back can fit two comfortably, three if you like each other! ).

Hey, you folks down in CT -- yeah, you Simone! - wanna make this a two-state meetup-event? Let's chat...

CHEERS!

Connie Cassidy,
Co-Organizer
Boston ASL


PEACE...
item.name: DeafNation Expo! - Sept. 25, 2010
